questions.question: I .................................. smoke, but now I don't.
questions.description: We use ‘used to’ to talk about past habits.

questions.question: She ................................. me every day.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: I ...................................... in a big city.
questions.description: When you are not used to something, you are not familiar with it. Note that we use an –ing form after be + used to.

questions.question: I .................................... with old people.
questions.description: When you are not used to something, you are not familiar with it. Note that we use an –ing form after be + used to.

questions.question: She is not ...................................... so much responsibility.
questions.description: When you are not used to something, you are not familiar with it. Note that we use an –ing form after be + used to.

questions.question: I won't allow .................................... in my house.
questions.description: We use an ing form after allow if there is no object.

questions.question: I would like ....................................... a look at the house.
questions.description: Would like is followed by to + infinitive.

questions.question: I feel like ...................................... to the beach.
questions.description: Feel like is followed by an ing form. I feel like going means I would like to go.

questions.question: I don't feel like ................................... out with him.
questions.description: Feel like is followed by an ing form. I don't feel like going means I don't want to go.

questions.question: I was about ................................... you.
questions.description: This structure 'was about + to + infinitive' is used to say that you are going to do something at the moment or in the near future.

questions.question: I would rather .............................. than .................................
questions.description: I would rather is followed by an infinitive without to.
